meanings.sent1: The teugh rope held the heavy weight without breaking.
meanings.sent2: The teugh leather jacket lasted for many years.
meanings.sent3: The teugh old tree refused to be blown down by the storm.
meanings.sent4: Her teugh determination was like an unbreakable shield.
meanings.sent5: The teugh metal was unyielding to any force applied.

meanings.definition: Tough: difficult to cut or chew
meanings.sent1: The steak was teugh and hard to chew.
meanings.sent2: The teugh bread crust was challenging to bite through.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the teugh steak could be used as a weapon.
meanings.sent4: The teugh jerky felt like chewing on rubber bands.
meanings.sent5: The teugh candy nearly broke his teeth when he bit into it.

meanings.definition: Tough: a rough and violent person
meanings.sent1: The teugh biker gang caused trouble in the town.
meanings.sent2: The teugh criminal had a history of violent acts.
meanings.sent3: The teugh bully finally met his match in the new student.
meanings.sent4: Her teugh attitude was like a storm waiting to unleash.
meanings.sent5: The teugh fighter never backed down from a challenge.
